description: MCP Server Configuration for UX Designers - Design System & Accessibility Bundle

figma.description: Design system integration with Code Connect and design token extraction
use_cases: Generate code from Figma designs with Code Connect
Extract design tokens (colors, typography, spacing) from Figma files
Sync component library between Figma and code
Create design system documentation from Figma specs
Map Figma components to real component implementations
Reference design specs in component documentation
figma.why_essential: Central source of truth for design system and component specs

a11y-mcp.description: AI-powered accessibility testing with Axe-core integration for WCAG compliance
use_cases: Run WCAG 2.1 AA/AAA compliance checks on designs
Validate color contrast ratios automatically
Check ARIA labels and semantic HTML structure
Test keyboard navigation and focus management
Generate accessibility audit reports
Validate design system components for accessibility
a11y-mcp.why_essential: Accessibility is core UX responsibility - automated testing is required

playwright.description: Browser automation for responsive testing and visual QA
use_cases: Test responsive design across breakpoints (mobile, tablet, desktop)
Validate UI implementation matches Figma designs
Test navigation flows and user journeys
Capture screenshots for design reviews and documentation
Test interaction states (hover, focus, active, disabled)
Visual regression testing for design system components
playwright.why_essential: Essential for validating implementation matches design intent

filesystem.description: File system access for design assets and component documentation
use_cases: Manage design asset files (SVGs, icons, images)
Read and validate design token files (CSS variables, JSON)
Access component documentation and style guides
Review CSS/SCSS files for design system
Organize design system documentation
filesystem.why_recommended: Critical for design asset management and documentation

memory.description: Persistent memory for design patterns and UX research findings
use_cases: Remember design system patterns and when to use them
Store UX research findings and user insights
Cache accessibility guidelines and best practices
Track design decisions and rationale
Remember component usage guidelines
Store user feedback themes
memory.why_recommended: Essential for maintaining design consistency and UX knowledge

slack.description: Team collaboration for design feedback and UX research sharing
use_cases: Share design feedback and reviews with team
Coordinate with developers on implementation
Post UX research findings to team channels
Send design system update announcements
Facilitate design critique sessions
Share accessibility audit results
slack.why_recommended: Critical for design collaboration and team communication

steps: 1. Use Figma to extract design specs and tokens
2. Load component implementation patterns from memory
3. Use Playwright to verify implementation matches design
4. Capture screenshots with Playwright for comparison
5. Use Filesystem to validate design token files
6. Store successful implementation patterns in memory
1. Use A11y MCP to run WCAG 2.1 AA compliance checks
2. Use Playwright for keyboard navigation testing
3. Check Figma designs for color contrast compliance
4. Use Playwright to test screen reader announcements
5. Generate accessibility audit report
6. Share findings via Slack with development team

responsive_design_testing.description: Test responsive design across all breakpoints
steps: 1. Load responsive breakpoints from Figma or memory
2. Use Playwright to test at mobile (375px), tablet (768px), desktop (1920px)
3. Capture screenshots at each breakpoint
4. Validate layout shifts and component responsiveness
5. Test touch interactions on mobile
6. Store responsive patterns in memory

design_system_documentation.description: Generate and maintain design system docs
steps: 1. Use Figma to extract component specs and variants
2. Use Filesystem to read existing component documentation
3. Load design system structure from memory
4. Generate component documentation with usage examples
5. Document accessibility requirements per component
6. Save documentation to Filesystem
1. Load component specs from Figma
2. Use Playwright to test all component states
3. Run A11y MCP accessibility checks
4. Validate design tokens via Filesystem
5. Test responsive behavior
6. Generate validation report

user_research_synthesis.description: Synthesize and share UX research findings
steps: 1. Store research findings and themes in memory
2. Use Filesystem to save research artifacts
3. Generate research summary document
4. Share insights via Slack with team
5. Link findings to design decisions in memory

figma: Use Code Connect to map designs to components
Keep Figma library in sync with code
Use Figma API for programmatic access
Link Figma frames to component docs
a11y_mcp: Run on every design system component
Test with WCAG 2.1 AA minimum (AAA for critical flows)
Validate color contrast for all text
Check ARIA labels on interactive elements
playwright: Test at 3 breakpoints minimum (mobile, tablet, desktop)
Test all interaction states (hover, focus, active)
Use device emulation for mobile testing
filesystem: Validate design token format (CSS vars, JSON)
memory: Store design patterns and when to use them

accessibility.wcag_level: WCAG 2.1 AA minimum (AAA for critical user flows)
accessibility.color_contrast: 4.5:1 for normal text, 3:1 for large text
accessibility.keyboard_navigation: All interactive elements must be keyboard accessible
accessibility.focus_indicators: Visible focus indicators on all interactive elements

responsive_design.flexible_layouts: Use relative units (rem, em, %) not pixels

design_system.version_control: Track design system changes with semantic versioning

performance.image_optimization: WebP format, lazy loading, responsive images
performance.animation_performance: 60fps, use CSS transforms, avoid layout thrashing

optimization_tips: Figma: Use Code Connect to auto-generate component code
A11y MCP: Run accessibility tests in CI/CD pipeline
Playwright: Capture visual regression baselines automatically
Filesystem: Automate design token extraction from Figma
Memory: Store common UX patterns for quick reference
Slack: Automate design system update notifications
